title: Better visualization of relationships in UML diagrams
Starting client failed
body:
Hi,

I fired up hyperledger fabric and the composer localy. So the composer is accessable on my machine at port 8080.

However I have a problem with the plugin in visual studio code: it is not able to to start the clinet and raises the following exception:

```
Starting client failed
Error: spawn /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper ENOENT
	at _errnoException (util.js:1024:11)
	at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:190:19)
	at onErrorNT (internal/child_process.js:372:16)
	at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:138:11)
	at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:180:9)
```
The result is that the functionality of the plugin seems to be not available.

My OS is macOS High Sierra Version 10.13.6. The Visual Studio Code Version is: 1.27.2

Any help is greatly appreciated.

# Feature Request
* Add a [`documentFormattingProvider`](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/language-support#_format-source-code-in-an-editor) ([API Reference](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#DocumentFormattingEditProvider)) that enables automatic formatting of `.cto` files when the `editor.action.formatDocument` command is executed

title: Add support for external models
body: To address https://github.com/hyperledger/composer-vscode-plugin/issues/82

title: Update the plugin to support import/from dependencies
body:
CTO files can import types from CTO files over the network, using the `import typeFqn from URL` syntax. Updating the plugin to support this would be very useful, not least because these imports don't make any assumptions about local files, or whether they have been opened in the editor.

Code to be updated is here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer-vscode-plugin/blob/master/server/src/server.ts#L367

The basic approach is to:

1. Call `addModelFile(s)/updateModelFile(s)`, but disable validation: https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/blob/master/packages/composer-common/lib/modelmanager.js#L149
2. Call `updateExternalModels` https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/blob/master/packages/composer-common/lib/modelmanager.js#L308 which will download external dependencies over the network into the `ModelManager`

A good source of models for testing with external dependencies is https://models.accordproject.org

title: Deliver FV/Integration tests for VSCode plugin
body:
Upon the completion of #78, the tests themselves should be delivered to enable closure of #62 

This issue is to be used to deliver the test code that fulfils the test descriptions/stubs delivered by #78

title: Scope and outline FV/Integration tests for Plugin
body:
This issue is to capture delivery of required FV/Integration testing of the VSCode extension, as part of #62 

[VSCode documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/testing-extensions) describes various ways to test the plugin. For clarification, the testing to be performed here is driving VSCode tests using the VSCode API to import documents/projects with a known good/bad structure and ensure that:
- known good projects show/list no errors
- known bad files show the correct errors

It should also be possible to generate a UML diagram within this framework, though I recommend considering this under a separate issue

The tests will span multiple files, since there are many Composer file types that are to be tested (ACLs, Models etc) and comprehensive testing of such items are best split out across dedicated test files, with a 'utility' file that is used to contain all common code.

The delivery requirement for this issue is:
- separate test file description for each item being tested
- each file to contain test stubs that describe the test, but do not contain the test code itself; this is to be delivered as part of a different issue

title: Make licenses consistent in VSCode Extension
body:
**Summary**
VSCode Extension uses VSCode and VS Language server in both client and server components respectively.  Current the extension source code is using MIT under Microsoft license.  The majority of code is written by us but using VSCode APIs and some places are using Apach 2 license.  We need to make licenses consistent within both client and server component.

title: As a user I want to be able to run the VSCode extension tests in both a command line and with a travis build
body:
**Abstract**
This story is for setting up initial test framework so that I can auto run the unit tests from a command line or in Travis CI. 
This includes set up mocha, ts-node and the Istanbul coverage report for the server component. 
Both Linux and Mac operating systems are support for Travis auto test.

**Implementation**
This implementation includes below steps:
1.  Set up mocha and ts-node for unit test framework for both server and client modules
2. Add Istanbul coverage report for server and client modules
3. Add test scripts for both server and client modules so that you can run npm test from each module.
4. Add Travis scripts for auto running test in Travis CI that supports both Linux and Mac
5. Add TSLint to validate both extension typescripts and test scripts  for both server and client modules.
6. Updated these typescript files as result of step 5.
7. Updated license with Apache 2 licenses in extension files.
8. Add Apache 2 license for all new files #65

title: Expects "identified by" field for Transaction and Event resource types
body:
As of [composer v0.9.0](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/releases/tag/v0.9.0) transactions and event resources should not define an identifier.  This plugin does not reflect this change.

e.g. The following code:
```

transaction IssueTokens {
  o Long amount
  --> Business recipient
}

```

Generates the following error:

```
file: 'file:////models/fitchain.cto'
severity: 'Error'
message: 'IllegalModelException: line 267 column 1, to line 272 column 2. Class IssueTokens is not declared as abstract. It must define an identifying field.'
at: '267,1'
source: 'Composer'
```

title: Entire document is underlined when a single error is reported
body:
**Current Behaviour:**
When an error is found, all the text in the document is underlined. This can make it very slow to identify the location of the error in your code. This is true for both `.cto` and `.acl` files.

**Expected Behaviour:**
Only the line of code or statement that contains the error should be highlighted.

**Image:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9294862/27181757-d4fa7aa0-51d0-11e7-8334-c5b502f8a99d.png)

title: Update version number
Create dco
Update ACL parser to deal with new syntax for transactions and operations
body:
**Can now handle the following syntax additions in ACLs.**

**For 'transaction's:**
transaction: "org.acme.vehicle.auction.Offer"
transaction(t): "org.acme.vehicle.auction.Offer"

**Lists for 'operation's, e.g.:**
operation: ALL
operation: UPDATE, DELETE
operation: CREATE, READ, UPATE, DELETE

**The "ANY" option for a 'participant' is now highlighted:**
participant: "ANY"

**Also, "paths" in 'participant', 'resource', 'transaction' are highlighted, e.g in:**
participant: "org.acme.vehicle.auction.Member"

Finally, there is a new snippet for a "Transaction Rule" to easily create a rule that has a transaction in it.

Signed-off-by: m-g-k <m-g-k@users.noreply.github.com>

title: Syntax highlighting for ACL files not working on Linux
body:
Syntax highlighting for ACL files not working on Linux, but it works fine on Windows and Mac,

## Context
Reported on Rocket chat by jdockter

## Expected Behavior
It should work the same on all platforms

## Actual Behavior
Error checking works, but the colour highlighting does not.

## Possible Fix
There is a type in the syntax file name that needs fixing.

## Steps to Reproduce
Open a permissions.acl file on Ubuntu and you will not get syntax highlighting like you do on other platforms for acl files.

## Existing issues
None

## Context
Syntax highlighting for ACL files not working on Linux, but it works fine on Windows and Mac,
